title: SB 1.18.7 | HH Stoka Krishna Swami | 29-03-2023 | Daily Evening Bhagavatam Discourse
speaker: HH Stoka Krishna Swami

segments.key_quote: Hare Krishna Hare Krishna Krishna Krishna Hare Hare, Hare Rama Hare Rama Rama Rama Hare Hare
segments.summary: The lecture begins with the chanting of prayers and mantras.

segments.key_quote: So he was never envious of the personality of Kali.
segments.summary: The speaker introduces the verse from Srimad Bhagavatam and explains that Maharaj Parikshit was not envious of Kali.

segments.key_quote: A person does not become a victim of a sinful activity until he actually performs that sinful activity.
segments.summary: The speaker explains a special facility in Kali Yuga: one is not affected by sinful reactions until the sinful act is actually performed, contrasting it with previous yugas.

segments.key_quote: a living being in this age is awarded with the results of pious acts simply by thinking of them.
segments.summary: The speaker contrasts sinful acts with pious acts in Kali Yuga, explaining that one can gain spiritual benefit simply by thinking of performing pious acts and reiterates Maharaj Parikshit's attitude towards Kali.

segments.key_quote: Pariksit Maharaj protected his subjects from falling prey to the sinful acts of the age of Kali and at the same time he gave full facility to the age of Kali by allotting him some particular places.
segments.summary: The speaker explains how Maharaj Parikshit protected his citizens from the sinful influence of Kali while still allowing Kali certain places to reside.

segments.key_quote: Kali can come and reside and spread the evil influence of spreading irreligious activities so to prevent Kali from spreading irreligious influence evil influence one should not give Kali a place to reside
segments.summary: The speaker uses the analogy of tuberculosis bacteria to explain how Kali spreads his influence and lists the five places where Kali resides: meat-eating, intoxication, gambling, illicit sex, and accumulating wealth.

segments.key_quote: one can attain salvation simply by chanting the holy name of the Lord
segments.summary: The speaker highlights the great advantage of Kali Yuga: one can attain liberation simply by chanting Hare Krishna, and mentions Maharaj Parikshit's efforts to propagate this chanting.

segments.key_quote: a Vaishnava is compassionate upon all the living beings but a Vaishnava never allows a sinful living entity to influence other innocent people in a negative way
segments.summary: The speaker emphasizes the importance of Krishna Katha and the role of a Vaishnava in protecting innocent people from negative influences.

segments.key_quote: so that is possible by keeping Kali away from the innocent people by constant engagement in different forms of devotional service
segments.summary: The speaker concludes by stating that Kali can be kept away from innocent people through constant engagement in devotional service.
